Evergreen trees to 25 m tall; trunk straight, 50 cm across; bark with deciduous scales, reddish-brown when young; buds ovoid, glabrous.

Fruit compressed-globose, 1 cm across, glabrous, with persistent reflexed enlarged tepals at base.

Leaves coriaceous, glabrous, entire, ovate-oblong to obovate-oblong, 6-9.5 cm long, 2.5-3.5 cm broad, with 3 main veins, acuminate or cuspidate at apex, obtuse, rounded or acute at base, midrib slightly elevated on both surfaces, lateral veins 4 pairs, glabrous above, glaucous beneath, veinlets subparallel, elevated; petioles 1.8 cm long, glabrous, dark brown when dry, sulcate above.
Inflorescences glomerulate, appearing September, 5-7-flowered; involucral bracts hirsute, 1-2 mm long, caducous; peduncles 1-2 mm long; pedicels 2 mm long, tomentose; staminate flowers with receptacle short campanulate, densely hirsute outside, glabrous inside; tepals 4, ovate-oblong, obtuse at apex, 2 mm long; fertile stamens 6, filaments 3 mm long, sparsely hirsute at base; pistillate flowers with receptacles obconic, 1 mm long, hirsute on both sides; tepals 4, lanceolate, 1 mm long, 0.7 mm broad, acute at apex, hirsute outside, glabrous inside; staminodes linear, sparsely hirsute at base; ovary ovoid, 1 mm long, densely hirsute at apex, subglabrous at base.
distribution_Taiwan: confined to the south central mountain regions.

characteristics:
Evergreen trees, trunk up to 15 m tall; Bark of male trees light yellow to grayish brown, smooth, lenticels prominent; that of female trees light green to grayish brown, smooth, with fewerm lenticels. Young twigs covered with dense pubescence of light gol
Leaves coriaceous, alternate or whirled-like, ovate, obovate lanceolate, or oblong lanceolate, 9.5±1.3 cm long and 3±0.5 cm wide; apex acuminate to caudate, forming 25.5±16.3° angles; base acute or cuneate, angles 27.5±7°. Young Leaves reddish brown, densely pilose of light yellow above, later becoming glabrous green; also densely pilose slightly wavy. Petioles 1.9±0.3 cm long, densely pilose light yellow at beginning, becoming whitish gray, then glabrous.
Dioecious, flowers light yellow, blooming October to November. Infloerscence umbel-like, axillary, each with 5 floretes; peduncles 3 mm long, densely covered with brownish pubescence. Involuvcres 4, decussate, densely pubescent outside and sparsely pubescent on inside of upper parts. Pedicels of male florets 6±0.5 mm long, female florets 3±0.2 mm long, both with dense pubescence. Tepals 4, 3.5±0.3 mm long and 2.2±0.2 mm wide in male flowers, 2.2±0.2 mm long and 0.8±0.2 mm wide in female; densely pubescent outside and sparsely pubescent inside. Male flowers with 6 stamens, 3-whirled, filaments 4 mm long, sparsely pubescent; anthers 4-celled, oblong, 1.5 mm in length, 0.8 mm in width. Stamens of 3 rd whorl with 2 stalkedglands, sterile ovary exists. Female flower oblong, glavrous, 1.5 mm long and 0.7±0.1 mm wide; stigma peltate; styles 1.7±0.2 mm long, pubescent.
Fruits drupe, globose to oblong, 1.2 cm long and 1.1 cm across; reddish; peduncles 0.9 cm long.

characteristics:
Medium-sized Evergreen trees; branches grayish, rugose, with lenticels; branchlets pubescent at first, darkening, later glabrous.
Leaves alternate, coriaceous, super posited, ovate to oblong, 6-8 cm long, 2-3.2 cm broad, falcate-acuminate at apex, obtuse at base, with 3 main veins, glabrous above, yellowish-golden pilose, appressed-sericeous beneath when young, midrib elevated on both surfaces, lateral veins 2-3 pairs, elevated on both surfaces, veinlets subparallel, transversely reticulate; petioles 2-2.5 cm long, gray-puberulent.

Fruit ellipsoid.

characteristics:
Small Evergreen trees; branchlets densely long light orange villose when young, later glabrate-tomentose, terete; buds ovoid, acute or obtuse at apex, densely sericeous-puberulent.
Leaves thinly coriaceous, ovate-oblong to oblong, 9-20 cm long, 4-8 cm broad, entire, cuspidate-acute to acuminate at apex, obtuse at base, glabrous and shining above, glaucous and pubescent beneath, tomentose along the veins beneath when young, with 3 main veins, midrib elevated on both surfaces, lateral veins ca. 4 pairs, reticulate veinlets obscure; petioles 1-2.5 cm long, stout, puberulent.
Inflorescences globose in bud, sessile; involucral bracts silky-puberulent outside, glabrous inside, elliptic, obtuse at apex, deciduous.
